qas.question: How long is Thuringian primary school?
For how long have Thuringian children been using the current education system?
When do children graduate from primary school in Thuringia?
Who invented the early years education in Thuringia?
How many years of school do students attend after primary?
How long is Thuringian primary school banned?
How long have Thuringian children been outside the current education system?
When do children quit primary school in Thuringia?
Who destroyed the early years education in Thuringia?
How many years of school do students miss after primary?

context: Early-years education is quite common in Thuringia. <a1_0><b6_0>Since the 1950s<b6_0/><a1_0/>, nearly all children have been using the service, whereas early-years education is less developed in western Germany. Its inventor <a3_0><b8_0>Friedrich Fröbel<b8_0/><a3_0/> lived in Thuringia and founded the world's first Kindergartens there in the 19th century. The Thuringian primary school takes <a0_0><b5_0>four years<b5_0/><a0_0/> and most primary schools are all-day schools offering optional extracurricular activities in the afternoon. <a2_0><b7_0>At the age of ten<b7_0/><a2_0/>, pupils are separated according to aptitude and proceed to either the Gymnasium or the Regelschule. The former leads to the Abitur exam after a further <a4_0><b9_0>eight years<b9_0/><a4_0/> and prepares for higher education, while the latter has a more vocational focus and finishes with exams after five or six years, comparable to the Hauptschule and Realschule found elsewhere in Germany.
